info.name: Fusion API
info.description:
All API methods can take requests via HTTP GET or HTTP POST methods. In a GET request parameters are sent as application/x-www-form-urlencoded data in the query string included in the URI.

POST requests receive parameters via application/x-www-form-urlencoded data in the body of the HTTP request.

All requests should include an Origin header to protect against CSRF (Cross Site Request Forgery) requests.

In order to authorise usage of the method, a parameter named requestid must be provided to all methods with an authentication token.


Contact Support:
 Email: devsupport@traveltek.net

item.name: Used to authenticate and retrieve a requestid, which is required for all other endpoints

urlencoded.description: (Required) A string to inform what type of access is required. More than one scope may be requested as a comma seperated list.
(Required) A string to inform what type of token is required, in all usual uses of the API the accepted value is 'client_credentials'

request.description:
To authenticate your application for access to the Traveltek Fusion API you will require a username and password.

The username and password must be included in the POST request via the Authorization header using the Basic access authentication method.

``` Authorization: Basic ```

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: basic

request.description: Book items contained in the basket of the specified session. The body of the request is a JSON object and the requestid must be sent within the headers.

query.description: (Required) Received from token.pl when you authenticated.
(Required) Unique identifier for your session.
(Required)
(Required) This is the 'itemkey' which is returned with each item on the basket endpoint.
(Required) This is the resultno of the optionalextra returned with the item on the basket endpoint.
If the extra can be added perpassenger (perpassenger will be 1 on the optionalextra) then this can be used to define the passenger number.
perpassenger extras can be added in multiples - this is used to define how many of the optional extra is to be added to the basket.

request.description:
Search for available cruise sailings matching parameters provided. This is the starting point for most cruise journeys, though it is possible to jump straight to cruisecabingrades.pl if you know the details of a cruise you want to price.

If a Line/Ship is specified in your search parameters, you can search up to a 90 day range, otherwise the limit is 30 days.
At this stage of the search this will pull back flatfile pricing and cached cruise info 

NOTE: if you have the code to cruise ID you can skip this step all together and move to the cruisecabingrades call

DO NOT use the result number from here for future requests, Use the result no from the cabingrades request for the selected cabin

Required: requestid, sid, site, startdate, enddate

Unique identifier for your session.

total number of children in the search

currency code to return results in. i.e. GBP
id for the cruise group to return results from. Cruise Groups can be set up within the iSell admin.
(Required) start of the date range to be used in cruise search
(Required) end of the date range to be used in cruise search
language code to return content in given language. Must be one of Traveltek's supported languages.
id for cruise line, if you want to limit your search to a specific cruise line
id for region
Set the resultkey for this search, can be used later to refer to a specific set of results within the same session.
id for cruise ship, if you want to limit your search to a specific cruise ship
(Required) Search ID to be used for this search. The Search ID defines the suppliers that are enabled and the credentials to be used.
(Required) The name of the site which the sid belongs to.
1 for 1-4 nights, 2 for 5-10, 3 for 11-16, 4 for 17-31, and 5 for 32+

request.description:
Descriptive content and itinerary for a specific sailing/codetocruiseid.

The content of the cruise will pull back images, Irinerary map, Port ID's, shipid, sailing id and lineID for the selected sailing. 
This is typically used to pull back a more in depth itinerary for the cruise and information about the ports. 

Required: requestid and codetocruiseid.

request.description:
This method retrieves all the available grade information about a cruise that was returned from a search but if you already have the Code to cruise ID you can also start from here in your search. It will also return the itinerary for that cruise. 

Here you will get the faretype codes, the resultno, gradeno, cabin code, and a fresh sessionkey if you are starting the search from here. 
Flight options will also appear here to the Iata and a short description of the cabins with thier cabin code, price, deckid and position

NOTE: Use the result number you get for the selected cabin here moving forward

Required params are:
Codetocruiseid 
Sid
Requestid

request.description:
This endpoint returns the pricing breakdown for the specified cabin grade, including information on which components of the price are commissionable.

In this response we also have price, currency and and tax for the specific cabin

Values for the parameters can be found in your cruisecabingrades response.


Required: requestid, sessionkey, cid (codetocruiseid), chosen cruise (resultno of cruise), chosencabingrade, chosenfarecode,

(Required)
If this is not provided, it will defualt to GBP
(Required) Even if your tour has no 'rooms', set this to 1. This is required due to how we handle passenger assignments

(Required) This refers to the number of adults in room 1. For room 2's adults, you would add another field e.g. &adults-2=2, and if there's more than 2 rooms then this would follow the same pattern e.g. &adults-3=1. If room count is 1, then only adults-1 is required.

(Required) This refers to the number of children in room 1. For room 2's children, you would add another field e.g. &children-2=1 and if there's more than 2 rooms then this would follow the same pattern e.g. &children-3=2. If room count is 1, then only children-1 is required.

(Required) This refers to the number of infants in room 1. For room 2's infants, you would add another field e.g. &infants-2=1 and if there's more than 2 rooms then this would follow the same pattern e.g. &infants-3=0. If room count is 1, then only infants-1 is required.

request.description:
Retrieves more detailed information when provided with passenger information. 

For additional adults/children/infants pass in syntax adults-2 for subsequesnt passengers

Required:, requestid, sid, sessionkey, resultkey, engineid, tourcode, servicecode, datecode, roomcount, adults-1, children-1, infants-1

(Required) This refers to the number of children in room 1. For room 2's children, you would add another field e.g. &children-2=1 and if there's more than 2 rooms then this would follow the same pattern e.g. &children-3=2. If room count is 1, then only children-1 is required.

(Required) This refers to the number of infants in room 1. For room 2's infants, you would add another field e.g. &infants-2=1 and if there's more than 2 rooms then this would follow the same pattern e.g. &infants-3=0. If room count is 1, then only infants-1 is required.
